newsitem.title: FINLAND: ROCLA SAYS HALTS OVERSUBSCRIBED SHARE OFFERINGS.
newsitem.headline: ROCLA SAYS HALTS OVERSUBSCRIBED SHARE OFFERINGS.

text.p: Finnish warehouse truck maker Rocla Oy said in a statement it had halted on Thursday the institutional and retail tranches of its share offering as subscription commitments exceeded 11 times the amount of shares on offer.
"The reason for the suspension is the strong demand for the shares," Rocla said.
"Institutional and retail shareholders made purchase and subscription commitments for about 21 million Rocla shares, which is 11 times the number of shares originally made available," it said.
Rocla said it expected the listing of its shares to start on the Helsinki stock exchange on or about June 17.
